reviews.review:
When I saw the trailer I was like omg an emoji movie, I had to go see it first because I love emoji. Then the critics starting trashing it so 2nd I had to go because pretentious movie people are the worst and I usually disagree. So I went to an 11:20am showing and thought I'd be alone, then like 20 families showed up. 

It was a kid's movie about a smiley face with an identity crisis, a villain who was not that scary, and a love interest with a mysterious background that ends up being fine. I'm not sure how you can in one sentence say that Sausage Party "would mix some interesting social critique into its animated entertainment " a movie about a stupid hot dog trying to get into a bun, and a lady's hygiene product filled with fruit punch, give me a break, and get off your high horse, then turn around and say Emoji Movie was a typical identity crisis kid's movie, and nothing more. "Ad placement" was just talking about apps on a phone, did you really want them to do the stupid movie trope creating fake apps? It's not garbage, but it's not great, it's 3 stars and maybe 30-25% not <10%.

The Emoji Movie was a great film. the jokes were funny. The voice acting was perfect. But, most importantly, the story was great. It wasn't like any other movie. i have a few complaints, though. Gene and Jailbreak didn't kiss. I know it isn't a big deal for most people, but for me it was. I would've given this a 5-star rating.

Worst part: When the high-five emoji ran in front of Gene and Jailbreak whilst the romantic music was playing. it almost ruined the whole film

Best part: When Gene and Jailbreak were dancing together in the Just Dance app. It made me dab.

I give this movie a 4.5 out of 5.
It's not as bad as everyone makes it out to be. It's a kids movie after all, and kids enjoy it, and that's all that matters. Also,  Wham! is great.
Emoji movie was a fun adventure, with a strong inner theme of inclusion.

Why does this movie exist, a waste of money, time and energy making and watching this movie. I'd rather drink gasoline and let myself spontaneously combust than watch this movie again that's why I give it a 1/2/5 stars.

"The Emoji Movie" is a dull, uninspired, humorless, recycled product. Rather than creating new memorable characters in interesting locations, the creators of this film reuse character tropes of recent animated films (Inside Out, Wreck in Ralph, Lego Movie) while using environments solely based off of mindless apps and product placements like Just Dance, Instagram and Spotify. Don't give money to Sony for this film. I despised it.

The movie is so cliche by watching the trailer you can already tell that the "Meh" emoji what's to be someone else but his mom and dad doesn't enjoy it the goth emoji is his "love interest" the Hi-5 Emoji is his "comic relief buddy" and The smiling girl emoji is the "enemy" in the movie like I've broken down for you guys I've seen the trailer so many times and my friends saw the movie and he said the movie was terrible as well

Hour long piece of advertising and garbage, interesting story to a horrible performance and execution. If you plan to see originality, than stay away from this crap fest. A line from the horrible video mashup of adds was from the high five "you don't need friends, you need fans!" Not only is that completely wrong it's also harmful to children. Don't waste $20 on this.
